capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed a male character in the Harry Potter series. I've always found him to be quite an intriguing figure, with his complex and sometimes dark personality. His strict demeanor and sharp tongue can be quite intimidating, but there's also a depth to him that makes him more interesting than just a one-dimensional villain.

Snape, the way he's always dressed in black, it's like he's trying to convey a sense of mystery and intimidation. I mean, who else would wear that much dark clothing all the time? It's almost as if he's trying to make a statement about himself, but what exactly is he trying to say?
